turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: He was going nuts at the park. He met this very attractive poodle. They made plans to meet again next weekend.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I guess you realize that there's something special that I want to talk to you about.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: For the last week things have been going pretty well between us. I think we've been doing a good job getting intimate and all that stuff...

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: How come in those foreign movies the young girl is always with some fat, old guy.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: In Europe women find older men very sexy.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: I don't think you're old and fat enough for me.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Why don't you come back up with me, Ronnie.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: I think I'll stand out here in the sun.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: It's all over, babe, it's all over.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: I've never seen sea so blue. Tahiti is magnificent, Scottie.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Yeah, I could get used to this Paradise shit.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Things have been going pretty well between us, haven't they?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: You've changed you know. I don't think there's anything you can't do once you put your mind to it.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: I was just thinking...  There's something special I want to talk to you about.  I think it's time we went to a whole other phase in our relationship.  A deeper level.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: That's right. We've got to bare it all. Here and now. 'Cause I think I'm finally ready to go for it...

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Whoa! Wait a minute, Ronnie. Hold on. I know it's beautiful here. The sun, the sand, the sea and all that nature shit can really get to you. But we've got to keep our perspective here. This place isn't real. This isn't reality.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I mean I said this trip should be a 'roadtest'.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I'm talking about... What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: I'm talking about me 'n' you stripping down on this beach and gettin' you know... 'naked in Tahiti'.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You talkin' about gettin' 'nekked?'  Shit, I thought you were talkin' bout, you know... the "M" word.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: You thought I was talking about getting married?!

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You crazy? With all those people around?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Know what you are?! You're a prude, Roper.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: First you want me to put on one of those skinny ass bathing suits -- tongs or thongs or whatever you call them -- with my butt cheeks wrapped around a piece of dental floss... No way.

turns.speaker: TRACK ANNOUNCER
turns.text: ...at the top of the stretch it's Cozy Girl in front with Backtrack coming on... Cozy Girl by a length, Backtrack closing...

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Come on. Stay up there, Cozy Girl...

turns.speaker: TRACK ANNOUNCER
turns.text: It's Cozy Girl holding on... Cozy Girl and Backtrack...

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I'm en route. E.T.A. in five.

turns.speaker: TRACK ANNOUNCER
turns.text: Cozy Girl in front by a neck... Now a head...

turns.speaker: TRACK ANNOUNCER
turns.text: Here comes the wire... and... Backtrack gets up in the last jump. Cozy girl a very game second.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Tell him to give me a raise.

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: He says, "Thank you very much."  I'll discuss it with him right now... Good-bye, Chief.

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: Are you going to make this hard for me?

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: There's been some concern about you continuing to work without back-up.

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: What if you die and no one can do what you do as well as you do it?

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: It's been decided that you take on another partner and train him to be able to take over for you.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Is that what the guy in the Sunday School suit is doing outside?

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: His name's Kevin McCall. Every Metro Captain agrees that he's their top sharp-shooter and most likely to succeed.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Great, send him to the Marines. This guy's not a negotiator. He'll quit in two weeks.

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: You let us worry about that.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Is there going to be an expression of your appreciation?

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: What kind of appreciation are we talking about?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: The financial kind. I figure I'm going to be working extra hours. All sorts of overtime... training sessions... Not to mention the extra stress...

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: What do you think would be in order?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Like ahh... I don't know...  Five thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: Okay, I think I could swing that.

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: Hey, you just got a five thousand dollar raise. Get a car of your own.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You know you've got nothing but cars down there in impound.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: The car is part of the deal.

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: What happened to your Trans Am?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: And even if this doesn't work, I want all the money. These SWAT guys don't have the temperament. They don't have the background...

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: The chief says to tell you how sorry he is. He knew Sam Baffert was a good man.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: He said he was just going up to talk to him. He said...  I want to be put on this case.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I want to be put on this case.

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: You know I can't assign you to this. You're much too close to it. You were much too close to Sam. The department will take care of it.

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: Kimura and Glass will head the investigation.

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: 32 minutes ago the silent alarm went off, then the fire alarm. A unit was a block away, and the suspect got trapped inside.

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: We've only seen and talked to one suspect. He calls himself "Joe". There's two jewelers, two salespeople, the manager, a security guard, and an elderly woman. This particular store is where they do a lot of jewelry making and repair. They have anywhere from 8 to 10 million in raw stones on any given day, so they sure as shit didn't just wander in. They knew what they were coming for.

turns.speaker: SOLIS
turns.text: Just that I'd talk to my superiors.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: Halden, how nice to hear your voice.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: I have found in life that what one wants isn't nearly as important as what one needs.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: I need to take back what's mine.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: There are two million people in there with you.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: They have nothing to do with this --

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: -- Two million people lost in the digital night.  What do they seek?

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: -- You've made your point!  You've got control of the system.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: System's running on auxiliary.  Only seven hours before it crashes.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: You're in there.  Everybody dies, you go with them --

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: -- But don't you remember?  I'm already dead.

turns.speaker: DIGITAL GENA
turns.text: She said I have a son...

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: No, she said she had a son.  In a dream she once called life.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: Because I took it out of your memory.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: -- Because there'll be no remorse. Not in my world.

turns.speaker: GENA
turns.text: As long as it's not 'what's your sign?'

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: If you could meet God, what would you say to him?

turns.speaker: GENA
turns.text: That's a strange question.  You a strange man?

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: There you are, sitting next to the creator, what do you say?

turns.speaker: GENA
turns.text: This is how you pick up women --

turns.speaker: GENA
turns.text: No, not me, I've been lucky.  But I've seen what happens to other people --

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: -- If your life's so good up there Gena, what are you doing down here?

turns.speaker: GENA
turns.text: I'm serious, how did you know my name?

turns.speaker: GENA
turns.text: You don't have much sex up there in the real world, do you?

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: That's the grace of this world.  Nothing's impossible.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: The patterns were moved around, but they weren't changed.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: Halden sent men to kill me in my sleep, but simple illusions won out.  So he now sends the legend to finish the deed.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: But what would happen to me?  I have no body to return to.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: God creates man, man creates technology, technology creates God.  End into beginning.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: You were the one who was dying.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: You sealed off the system.  When it crashes, everyone dies with you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: Yes, but only in the dream they call life.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: And all dreams, no matter how appealing, must eventually end.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: Unlimited energy out there.  Enough to run this world for all eternity --

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: -- But you'll never be able to get it through the maze.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: Me?  Of course not.  That's why you're here.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: With the energy from the net, we can program this world anyway we want.  Redwood forests.  Oceans. Mountains --

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Until you're on the net where the corporation can't touch you, you can't open the system.  They'll eject it if you do.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: But once the system touches the net, all links are severed.  Everybody dies.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: Only up there in the dream they called life.

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: Remember, I'm not the one who chose this.

turns.speaker: DEX
turns.text: Yes, so which one of us does that make the coward?

turns.speaker: DEX
turns.text: Where the hell are you going?

turns.speaker: CHRISTOPH
turns.text: Perfect opportunity for you to demonstrate your continued worth.

turns.speaker: DEX
turns.text: You sure he's going to come?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: We're going to have to reconfigure.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: Have communications contact all interface centers.  Tell them due to high demand, we're at full capacity and so temporarily there's no room for anyone else on the system.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: What about the customers with reservations?

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: Have the staff apologize profusely and issue credit vouchers.  But remember, it's a capacity problem.  That's all.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: -- He says the maze has been changed. I need to know for sure.

turns.speaker: GENA
turns.text: Take care?  Where the hell are you going --

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: Of course the legend would like to think that.  But no one has keys.  Your maze was run.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: Get some internal police there. Tell them to run a perimeter.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: But have them wait for me 'till they move in on him.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: Doesn't make sense.  How the hell does some fucking teenager get to the keys?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Sorry, I just design the maze.  Keeping the keys secure is your job.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Someone sends the kid a copy of the access program, then runs the maze at the same time the kid does, using the same codes.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Won't be time if he gets access --

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: He had access to the keys --

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: We can be there in fifteen minutes and rip him off the system.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: He's not plugged-into the system. He's in the fucking system!

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: Christoph had spinal cancer.  His body kept rejecting gene therapy. He was desperate.  It was him, it wasn't us --

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: Of course they are.  Christoph was stealing every piece of code he could get his hands on.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Because why the hell would you be interested in a program that allows people to live inside your machines?  I mean how much profit could there possibly be from owning the universe and selling space in it to people who are dying, or people who are just God-Damned sick of this world --

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: -- Come on, you know F.C.O. regs. Anyone caught with their R and D hand in the bio-digitization cookie jar spends the rest of their life in federal penitentiary.  It's not worth it.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: The only way to eject it is from the inside.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: You've got the keys, send someone in --

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: The Terrace.  First building Christoph ever programmed for us.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: Christoph was a brilliant programmer, but very eccentric.  He insisted it be kept vacant.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Christoph was in charge of designing building modules.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Then what's with all the staffing programs in his account?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Be a hell of a lot easier to digitize a real person, then strip them down to a module you can use to make as many employee programs as you need.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: Yes, in theory, I suppose that would work.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: Listen to yourself.  Digitization.  You know that officially that's a pure fantasy --

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: We drugged her.  So she wouldn't remember.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: There was no need to kill her.

turns.speaker: HALDEN
turns.text: Come on Tanner, think this through.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: If she's alive, you get it back.

turns.speaker: KATIE
turns.text: Some things never change, do they?

turns.speaker: KATIE
turns.text: Someone you have to get back to?

turns.speaker: KATIE
turns.text: I'm sorry sir, we need your debit card before we can issue a credit --

turns.speaker: KATIE
turns.text: Then how do you know about --

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Most nights you wake up crying. Never knowing why.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: We worked together on the inside. You were on my programming team --

turns.speaker: KATIE
turns.text: That's not possible.  No one can do that.
